collection.authors: S. M. Helfinstein, T. Schonberg, E. Congdon, K. H. Karlsgodt, J. A. Mumford, F. W. Sabb, T. D. Cannon, E. D. London, R. M. Bilder and R. A. Poldrack
collection.journal: Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences
collection.title: Predicting risky choices from brain activity patterns

contrast: pre-cash trials minus pre-pump trials matched for risk level
description:
Contrast between trials preceding cashout trials and trials preceding pump trials in the BART (trials matched for level of risk)

This contrast is contrasting trials immediately preceding a cashout vs. trials immediately preceding a pump. However, the pre-pump condition only contains a subset of all the pre-pump trials for that participant that are matched to the risk level of that participant's pre-cashout trials. So both the pre-pump and pre-cashout regressor would include 3 trials from pump #3, 5 trials from pump #4, 2 trials from pump #5, and so on.
